it.cnr.isti.labse.glimpse.consumer
Interface MonitorConsumer

All Known Implementing Classes:
MonitorEvaluationImpl
public interface MonitorConsumer

Implementing this interface to create a communication with the monitoring Enabler.

To correctly use the monitoring, the connection parameters must be configured using the following methods:
initConnection(Properties, boolean)
createConnection(InitialContext, Properties, boolean)


How the Monitoring Enabler works:
-> To request an evaluation to the monitoring enabler, a client
must be able to send a well formed request: a JMS Message which payload
is an xml containing a set of actions expressed using the
ComplexEventRule.xsd schema.
To aid on the creation of the XML, you can use the class ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument.
Possible XML actions are: Insert Delete Start Stop Restart.

When a well structured message (see exampleRule.xml in the APITestProject example) is received from the monitoring infrastructure
the monitoring will provide a responseMessage (TextMessage) containing the name
of the private topic where all the messages related to the requested evaluation will be sent.
When the enabler receives this message, should subscribes the new channel.
For this action, it can be use the method connectToTheResponseChannel(TopicConnection, String, boolean)

************************************************************************
**************An usage example is available here TestClass**************
************************************************************************

Version:
0.2
Author:
Antonello Calabrò
See Also:
initConnection method set InitialContext
, set TopicConnectionFactory

getMonitorStatusMessage

javax.jms.TextMessage getMonitorStatusMessage(javax.jms.TopicSession publishSession,
                                              boolean debug)
Parameters:
publishSession - the TopicSession where to send the message
debug - debug value
Returns:
a TextMessage that can be sent to the monitoring infrastructure
to obtain the Status of the monitoring enabler
that is defined using the enum Status

createSettingsPropertiesObject

java.util.Properties createSettingsPropertiesObject(java.lang.String javaNamingFactoryInitial,
                                                    java.lang.String javaNamingProviderUrl,
                                                    java.lang.String javaNamingSecurityPrincipal,
                                                    java.lang.String javaNamingSecurityCredential,
                                                    java.lang.String connectionFactoryNames,
                                                    java.lang.String topicServiceTopic,
                                                    boolean debug)
The returned Properties object can be used to simply setup connection using it with the following methods:

InitialContext initConnection(Properties settings)
TopicConnectionFactory createConnectionFactory(InitialContext initConn, Properties settings)

Parameters:
javaNamingFactoryInitial - eg: org.apache.activemq.jndi.ActiveMQInitialContextFactory
javaNamingProviderUrl - eg: tcp://atlantis.isti.cnr.it:61616
javaNamingSecurityPrincipal - eg: system
javaNamingSecurityCredential - eg: manager
connectionFactoryNames - eg: TopicCF
topicServiceTopic - eg: jms.serviceTopic
debug - debug value
Returns:
a Properties object that can be used to setup the connection

sendActionListMessage

void sendActionListMessage(javax.jms.TopicConnection connection,
                           javax.naming.InitialContext initContext,
                           java.lang.String serviceChannel,
                           it.cnr.isti.labse.glimpse.xml.complexEventRule.ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument actionList,
                           boolean debug)
                           throws javax.jms.JMSException,
                                  javax.naming.NamingException
Send a ActionList of rules to the monitoring infrastructure requesting an evaluation.
If the request is accepted, the monitoring will answer with a responseChannel where to connect
The actionList parameter is a list of action to provide to the Monitoring
To create it, you can use ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument class.

Parameters:
connection -
initContext -
serviceChannel -
actionList -
debug - debug value
Throws:
javax.jms.JMSException
javax.naming.NamingException

createSubscriber

javax.jms.TopicSubscriber createSubscriber(javax.jms.TopicConnection connection,
                                           javax.naming.InitialContext initContext,
                                           java.lang.String serviceChannel,
                                           boolean debug)
                                           throws javax.jms.JMSException,
                                                  javax.naming.NamingException
This class creates the Subscriber to receive answers from monitoring
must be used after the connection init and setup, see
createConnection(InitialContext, Properties, boolean) method and initConnection(Properties, boolean) method

Parameters:
connection - the TopicConnection, can be created using
createConnection(InitialContext, Properties, boolean) method
initContext - the JMS InitialContext, can be created using
initConnection(Properties, boolean) method
serviceChannel - the channel where the monitoring is listening for requests
the default channel is serviceTopic
debug - debug value
Returns:
a topic Subscriber to receive answers from monitoring.
Throws:
javax.jms.JMSException
javax.naming.NamingException

                                                                                                                                    throws org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlException,
                                                                                                                                           javax.jms.JMSException

the rule must be expressed using the ComplexEventRuleAction format,
for more information see ComplexEventRule documentation
debug - debug value
Returns:

Throws:
org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlException

connectToTheResponseChannel

javax.jms.TopicSubscriber connectToTheResponseChannel(javax.jms.TopicConnection connection,
                                                      java.lang.String responseChannel,
                                                      boolean debug)
                                                      throws javax.jms.JMSException
this method aid to switch channel after receiving a response from the
monitoring infrastructure. After sending a request, the monitor
will provide a new channel where to listen for response. Using this method is possible to obtain a new TopicSubscriber
for the new channel and set it on the MessageListener of the class tSub.setMessageListener(this);

Parameters:
connection - the connection to the server
responseChannel - the channel where to connect to receive response
debug - debug value
Returns:
the new topic where to listen for response
Throws:
javax.jms.JMSException

getAnswerTopicFromTextMessage

java.lang.String getAnswerTopicFromTextMessage(javax.jms.TextMessage msg)
                                               throws javax.jms.JMSException
Parameters:
msg - the message received from the monitoring
after sending a request
Returns:
a string containing the name of the topic where
to connect to fetch the evaluation results.
Throws:
javax.jms.JMSException
